msItem.title: Part of a small book of the Vowel-points of the Scriptures
msItem.rubric: ܒܫܡ ܐܒܐ ܘܒ[ܪܐ ܘܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ] ܡܪܝܡܬܐ. ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕ[ܢܟܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܦܘܫ]ܩܐ ܕܫܡܗ̈ܐ ܕܟܬܒ̈ܐ ܩܕܝܫ̈ܐ ܕܣܘ[ܪ̈ܝܝܐ. ܠܗܓܝ]ܢܐ ܘܠܩܪܝܢܐ ܕܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ̣. ܟܕ ܐܝܟ ܛܟܣܐ ܥܬܝܩܐ ܡܢ ܠܬܚܬ ܫܪܝܢܢ

msItem.title: The Proverbs of Jesus the son of Sirach
Ecclesiastes
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܩܘ[ܗܠܬ ܒܪ] ܕܘܝܕ ܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܘܡ̈ܠܐ

msItem.title: Unidentifiable
msItem.note: The remaining leaves, foll. 8—12, are so much stained and soiled, that the rubrics are in general no longer legible.

msItem.title: Judith and Esther
msItem.note: The contents of fol. 11a are uncertain.

item.p: Vellum, about 4 7/8 in. by 5, consisting of 12 leaves, most of which are more or less soiled and torn. The quires are signed with letters (ܒ, fol. 7b). There are from 21 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of about the xth cent., with numerous Greek vowels and other points ܰ, ܶ, ܺ,ܳ,ܽ, as ܠܰܡܕ̣ܩܘ, ܡ̇ܠܟ݂, ܕ̇ܬ݂ܘܽܩܦ݂ܳܐ).
See additions.

item.p: A mutilated note on fol. 1a indicates that the book belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

item.p: Four vellum leaves, about 7 1/2 in. by 5 1/8 (Add. 14,667, foll. 13—16), with from 22 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

msItem.title: Prayers, prooemia, and sedras, introductory to the celebration of the holy Eucharist
An Anaphora
msItem.note: Imperfect both at the beginning and end.

item.p: Twelve vellum leaves, about 7 in. by 5 3/8, all more or less torn (Add. 14,667, foll. 17—28). There are from 17 to 23 lines in each page. These leaves are palimpsest.

handNote.desc: The writing is of the xth or xith cent.
The original Estrangela writing of the under text has been almost completely effaced.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xth or xith cent.

item.p: Two vellum leaves, 6 5/8 in. by 4 1/2, slightly stained and torn.

handNote.desc: The note includes some dates, the latest of which is A. Gr. 1368, A.D. 1057.

item.p: A note with some dates, the latest of which is A. Gr. 1368, A.D. 1057.

p.quote: ܡܟܪ ܝܘܣܦ ܏ܩܫ ܡܢ ܕܝܡܛ ܏ܩܫ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܬܠܬܡܐ ܘܬܫܥ (sic) ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܘܒܪܝܟ ܐܬܐܗ (sic) ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܏ܫܣܓ ܘܗܘܐ ܏ܩܫ ܒܬܪ ܫܒܥܐ ܝܪ̈ܚܐ ܒܗ̇ ܒܫܢܬܐ ܗܘܬ ܣܝܕܗ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܏ܘܫܣܗ: ܒܐܒ ܗܘܬ ܓܠܝܗ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܏ܘܫܣܙ ܒܟܢܘܢ ܚܪܝ ܒܗ ܘܗܘܐ ܣܝܡܥܢ (sic) ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܏ܘܫܣܚ ܒܚܪܬܗ ܕܬܡܘܙ

msItem.title: A canon for the Annunciation of Zacharias

item.p: Four vellum leaves, about 7 in. by 5, with from 20 to 23 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: Written in a good, current hand of the xth cent.

item.p: On the verso of the fourth leaf there is a note, stating that the volume of canons, of which this formed part, was presented to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by the patriarch Abraham (or Ephraim), when Salībā was abbat, between A.D. 977 and 981.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ (sic) ܣܘܪܝܝܐ ܫܟܢܗ ܕܝܢ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܨܠܝܒܐ ܪܝܫܕܝܪܐ ܟܠ ܕܡܦܩܠܗ ܡܢ ܡܕܒܪܐ ܥܠ ܚܪܡܐ ܥܒܪ

item.p: A note, in the usual form, relating to the donation by the abbat Moses of Nisibis to the library of the convent of S. Mary Deipara, A. Gr. 1243, A.D. 932.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons
